newsitem.title: USA: American, pilots to resume contract talks this week.
newsitem.headline: American, pilots to resume contract talks this week.

text.p: American Airlines and its pilots' union will resume contract talks this week at an undisclosed site, the two sides said Wednesday.

The Allied Pilots Association said the talks would be held on Friday, but American said only that they would resume this week. The talks would be mediated by Robert Harris, chairman of the Presidential Emergency Board that is trying to resolve the dispute between the nation's number two carrier and the 9,300 member pilots union.
It will be the first meeting of American and its pilots since Feb. 14, when a week of around-the-clock negotiations collapsed and the union went on strike.
The pilots returned to work within minutes under the terms of three-member board President Bill Clinton established to try to come up with proposals to settle the dispute.
Pilots spokesman Gregg Overman said one day of talks was planned but he thought it likely the talks would be extended.
The site of the negotiations was not disclosed. The last round drew heavy media coverage, with both sides holding frequent press briefings.
